headline.main: In Britain, Child’s Weight Leads to Parents’ Arrest

docs.lead_paragraph: The police called it a rare step when they arrested the parents of a 210-pound, 11-year-old boy on suspicion of neglect and child cruelty.
docs.snippet: The police called it a rare step when they arrested the parents of a 210-pound, 11-year-old boy on suspicion of neglect and child cruelty.

headline.print_headline: Coke Ad: It Takes 23 Minutes to Burn Off a Soda
headline.main: Coke Ad: It Takes 23 Minutes to Burn Off a Soda

docs.lead_paragraph: Coca-Cola is taking on obesity, this time with an online video showing how fun it could be to burn off the 140 calories in a can of its soda.
docs.snippet: Coca-Cola is taking on obesity, this time with an online video showing how fun it could be to burn off the 140 calories in a can of its soda.

docs.lead_paragraph: A guide to movies playing at theaters in the New York City area, as well as select festivals and film series.
docs.snippet: A guide to movies playing at theaters in the New York City area, as well as select festivals and film series.

headline.print_headline: California Residents Support Soda Tax to Fight Obesity, Health Study Shows
headline.main: California Residents Support Soda Tax to Fight Obesity, Health Study Shows

docs.lead_paragraph: Fighting obesity by taxing sugary drinks and restricting junk food advertisements aimed at children has support from a wide majority of residents surveyed in a Southern California public health study released on Thursday.
docs.snippet: Fighting obesity by taxing sugary drinks and restricting junk food advertisements aimed at children has support from a wide majority of residents surveyed in a Southern California public health study released on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: City Soda Fight, in Court, Tests Agency’s Power
headline.main: New York City Soda Fight, in Court, Tests Agency’s Power

docs.abstract: American soft-drink industry says New York City's Board of Health is going beyond its powers in trying to regulate the size of sugary drinks in effort to combat obesity; if argument is upheld in court, it could limit the role of mayors and pubic health agencies to influence consumer behavior, as well as rewrite the role of the board.
docs.lead_paragraph: Much more than soda is at stake in New York’s battle over sugary drinks.
docs.snippet: Much more than soda is at stake in New York’s battle over sugary drinks.

headline.print_headline: Second Wave of Former Players Join NFL Lawsuit
headline.main: Second Wave of Former Players Join NFL Lawsuit

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Pro Bowl defender Marcellus Wiley added his name to a lawsuit accusing NFL teams of illegally dispensing powerful narcotics and other drugs to keep players on the field without regard for their long-term health.
docs.snippet: Former Pro Bowl defender Marcellus Wiley added his name to a lawsuit accusing NFL teams of illegally dispensing powerful narcotics and other drugs to keep players on the field without regard for their long-term health.

headline.print_headline: State Court Considers Restoring NYC Big-Soda Ban
headline.main: State Court Considers Restoring NYC Big-Soda Ban

docs.lead_paragraph: New York City officials urged the state's top court on Wednesday to reinstate the city's ban on big sodas, arguing that the local Board of Health has authority to restrict products that make people obese and contribute to disease.
docs.snippet: New York City officials urged the state's top court on Wednesday to reinstate the city's ban on big sodas, arguing that the local Board of Health has authority to restrict products that make people obese and contribute to disease.

headline.print_headline: No Nation Has Lowered Obesity Rate in 33 Years
headline.main: No Nation Has Lowered Obesity Rate in 33 Years

docs.abstract: Study published in journal The Lancet finds that nearly 30 percent of world's population is overweight or obese and not one country has reduced its obesity rate in 33 years.
docs.lead_paragraph: A study of data from 188 countries finds that obesity abounds in rich and poor countries alike, and sometimes neighbors have quite different levels.
docs.snippet: A study of data from 188 countries finds that obesity abounds in rich and poor countries alike, and sometimes neighbors have quite different levels.

headline.print_headline: Study Examines Efficacy of Taxes on Sugary Drinks
headline.main: Study Examines Efficacy of Taxes on Sugary Drinks

docs.abstract: Study published online by the American Journal of Agricultural Economics suggests that applying tax based on amount of calories contained in a serving of sugary drinks, rather than its size, would be more effective at curbing consumption.
docs.lead_paragraph: A system that is based on calories rather than size would be fairer to consumers and could curb consumption, according to research financed by an organization that advocates the tax.
docs.snippet: A system that is based on calories rather than size would be fairer to consumers and could curb consumption, according to research financed by an organization that advocates the tax.

docs.abstract: Sanford E DeVoe Gray Matter column describes series of experiments demonstrating that the mere idea of McDonald's and other fast food restaurants causes people to act and think more rashly.
docs.lead_paragraph: Does eating at McDonald’s make you financially impatient?
docs.snippet: Does eating at McDonald’s make you financially impatient?
